sen.j: 茶陶として名高く、遠州七窯の一つに数えられる。

sen.e: It is characterized as black-tone tesu gusuri (iron glaze) and its simple and delicate style embodys a sprit of 'Kirei sabi' (rich beauty and refined simplicity), which Enshu held up.

sen.e: In the early Edo period, Zeze-yaki ware was first produced under the patronage of Zeze Domain.

sen.j: 藩主石川忠総は茶人、小堀遠州と親交が深かった。

sen.j: そこで、遠州の指導を受けた膳所焼は評判を上げ、茶入や水指などは諸大名らの贈答品として重宝された。
sen.e: With guidance from Enshu, Zeze-yaki ware earned a reputation and its cha-ire (a thea caddy) and mizu-sashi (a water conatiner) became useful gifts of feudal lords.

sen.e: In 1919, a local man Kenzo IWASAKI, who felt sorry for the extinction of Zeze-yaki ware, and his friend Shunkyo YAMAMOTO, a master artist together built a nobori-gama (a stepped kiln) and reestablished the business.
